title: Travel briefs: Local travel events

Travel briefs: Local travel events Travel Sunday July 26, 2015 5:00 AM Lincoln library to explore his dealings with Jews 
An exhibit about Abraham Lincoln’s relationship with Jewish Americans will open next month in Springfield, Ill. 
The Abraham Lincoln Presidential Library and Museum will host “With Firmness in the Right: Lincoln and the Jews” from Aug. 3 through Nov. 15. 
The exhibit will include documents, letters, photos, Bibles and other artifacts — some of which haven’t been publicly displayed before. Lincoln’s appointment of the U.S. military’s first Jewish chaplain is among the documents. 
The exhibit is a revised version of an exhibit that opened earlier in the year at the New York Historical Society. It was inspired by the book Lincoln and the Jews: A History by Jonathan D. Sarna and Benjamin Shapell. Winner of statue contest gets underwater wedding 
Aug. 25 will mark 50 years since a statue of Christ was submerged 5 miles off Key Largo in the Florida Keys. 
The 9-foot bronze Christ of the Deep statue rests in 25 feet of water in the Florida Keys National Marine Sanctuary. It has become a symbol for Key Largo’s John Pennekamp Coral Reef State Park, which is part of the sanctuary. 
The statue, a replica of a sculpture in Italy, is a tourist attraction for snorkelers, divers and passengers on glass-bottomed boats who can see it from the surface. 
To mark the anniversary, Amy Slate’s Amoray Dive Resort in Key Largo is sponsoring a contest with a prize of an underwater wedding at the statue and a stay at the resort for the best 100-word essay from a couple who would like to be married under the sea. 
The entry deadline is July 31. Visit www.fla-keys.com/news/news.cfm?sid=9152 New website offers details about cycling Erie Canal 
There is more than one way to travel the Erie Canal, and it doesn’t have to be by boat. 
A new website, www.cycletheeriecanal.com , is all about cycling the mostly flat 360-mile trail that runs alongside the famous waterway between Albany and Buffalo in upstate New York. 
The website includes rider reviews, an interactive map, places to stay and suggestions for things to do and see along the way, from the Glimmerglass Opera near Cooperstown to the Susan B. Anthony House in Rochester. 
— From wire reports
